Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli UB1005 (MIC=4 µg/ml), E. coli DC2 (MIC=4 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (defensin-sensitive) (MIC=2 µg/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC=8 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa K799 (MIC=32 µg/ml), P. aeruginosa Z61 (MIC=16 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus SAP0017 (MIC=32 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=16 µg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=2 µg/ml).Yeasy:Candida albicans (MIC=64 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The CD spectra of PM1-S indicates that, in all environments (phosphate buffer, TFE, and liposomes), the peptide displays no observable patterns that could be related to structural features. This indicates that PM1-S is a flexible molecule with no favoured conformation.
Sequence Information.Function: PM1-S remaines active against Gram-negative bacteria but displayed poor activity to both Gram-positive and fungal microorganisms.

Literature.Title: Structure-activity relationships for the beta-hairpin cationic antimicrobial peptide polyphemusin I.
Literature.Author: Powers JP, Rozek A, Hancock RE.
